subject: Home & DIY
title: Virtual Water: The Hidden Water in Products
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Virtual Water: The Hidden Water in Products.

hook.text: A single cotton t-shirt requires 2,700 liters of water to produce. That's what one person drinks in 2.5 years.

buildup.text: Virtual water is the total water used to produce a productâ€”growing, processing, transporting, and manufacturing it.

discovery.text: One kilo of beef needs 15,400 liters of virtual water. Chicken needs 4,300. Lentils need just 1,250.

twist.text: Countries like the UK import more virtual water than they use locally. The footprint is invisible but enormous.

climax.text: Understanding virtual water shifts focus from shorter showers to food choices with far greater water impact.

punchline.text: The water you can't see uses more than the water you can.

quiz.question: How much virtual water does producing one kilogram of beef require?
